website_summaries.verdict: Written by a pediatrician, this highly popular, comprehensive book is specifically for fathers of girls.
pros: Lots of information for dads of daughters, covering all ages from newborn to adult children
Advice supported by research and true stories
Touches on a wide-range of sensitive topics
Emphasizes the huge impact men have on their daughters’ lives
Something in the book for everyone, including mothers and daughters
cons: Some readers consider the author's tone unnecessarily fear-based and negative
Also, this is a faith-based book, which limits its appeal

customer_reviews.title: Very religion based...
customer_reviews.text: WAAAY to religious based. Should read with that. Got about 30 pages in and had to out it down. We're it accurately describes I'd have saved my money. If you're religious or stuck in 1958, go ahead and buy this, otherwise, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Just so so.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this book was decent, definitely not great. Dr. Meeker makes some overall helpful points but also said things that I felt were unreasonable for example praising her father for not allowing her to date someone he just "had a bad feeling about" who later turned out to be a cheater. She also stated that a father's love would protect your daughter from bullying. It won't. However, for the average Dad just wanting a quick read and some pointers I think this book is fine. It basically affirms you need to spend quality time with your daughters, talk to them, set boundaries for them, and make sure they know you think they're important.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Lobert

customer_reviews.title: A feminist's plea to indispensable men
customer_reviews.text: Dr. Meeker is a self-described feminist whose career-long exposure to troubled girls has given her a deep and scientifically-buttressed belief in the irreplaceability of healthy, engaged, moral and patient fathers to the emotional development of their daughters. But before we have time to gloat at the fish-and-bicycles crowd, she hits us with marching orders that are no walk in the park (despite including walks in the park). An excellent, factual, refreshingly politically incorrect and highly actionable manual for any father who loves his daughter enough to want to set her up for a life of joy and success. The rest should read it, too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Book and GREAT GIFT FOR ANY NEW DAD!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this book for every first time father you know. Doesn't matter if the new Dad has a daughter or son. This book is amazing and will help you be a better man, Dad and also understand better the role of a Dad. It WILL scare you as it will explain just how important you are and what a giant impact a Dad has in the future of his children. This book is a must. It is a wonderful gift for any new Dad. I don't know how many I have given out now and I always am thanked well after it is read.
customer_reviews.author: User 47

customer_reviews.title: Good book. Although much of it seems like common ...
customer_reviews.text: Good book. Although much of it seems like common sense. I have nearly finished the book and the gist of it seems to be, be a good dad as well as a good honest person and stay involved in your daughters life and they will turn out to be good, well rounded adult women. It does help you want to be a better dad in the sense that it helps you to realize that the decisions you make in your life can and will have repercussions in the life of your daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Grateful for the perspective
customer_reviews.text: As a guy, there are things in here I just wouldn't have realized in my own. The perspective from a woman with deep experience in this arena was immensely valuable to me. As a Christian, I also appreciated her perspective on faith, but even for those who don't believe in God, I still would recommend this as long as they can look past the lies that culture is spewing to our women and daughters.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Must-Read Book for Every Father Who Loves His Daughter
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd read this 15 years ago! This is an outstanding book, well-written by a physician whose practice has included hundreds if not thousands of girls over the years. She knows of what she writes. The author shows how society, media and the entertainment complex are awash with complex narratives which are hurtful and even dangerous to the healthy development of young people. She also explains how dads are uniquely positioned to help protect their daughters and help them safely navigate many of the resulting challenges. A great gift for any dad and one of the best investments any dad could make in the future health and happiness of his daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Mandl

customer_reviews.title: Too focused on God and full of misinformation...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had looked at the negative reviews first. This chick comes off as a psycho dad from the 50s. Which is very odd to say. Preaching methods that have been proven to harm the mental state of a child later in development. Seems like she just wants us to scare our daughters into believing in God and relying on men for safety and happiness. Do yourself a favor and shop around first. Your daughter's life shouldn't suffer due to this self righteous Morton's dated and misinformed views.
customer_reviews.author: Toasty

customer_reviews.title: this book is a great reminder that this responsibility should be taken very seriously ...
customer_reviews.text: The general message of this book is sound: the influence a father has in his daughter's life is huge. If nothing else, this book is a great reminder that this responsibility should be taken very seriously and should be done with pro-activeness and intention. Unfortunately, for me, the author's suggestions are over-the-top and too controlling/helicopter-parenting-like. In the author's defense, this book was written 10+ years ago, and times have certainly changed since then.
customer_reviews.author: MLeland

customer_reviews.title: Overall great.....but
customer_reviews.text: The first 90% is wonderful and gives great advice and motivation to be the best dad possible. The ending gets too religious especially if you're not catholic. She essentially advocates for raising the child in a Judeo-Christian household and there's no mention of any other belief system. I found this exclusionary chapter the only bad part of the book. There are plenty of good hearted, morally/ethically sound, high achieving productive members of society who are not raised in a Judeo-Christian households. Including myself, my wife and both of our immediate and extended families.
customer_reviews.author: varan haghshenas

customer_reviews.title: Toss it in the trash
customer_reviews.text: My Partner felt the book was more about the author gloating on her social status than anything else and she had a very negative outlook on things, fear mongering tactics and Misinformation.
customer_reviews.author: Nikole

customer_reviews.title: Great book! All fathers should read, often.
customer_reviews.text: This book has so much information for dads of daughters. It covers all ages from newborn to adults children. It reinforces principles that I think dads already know are right, but the culture may disagree on. It helps give dads confidence to stick to those principles. I don't often read books more than once, but this is a book I plan to read every few years, if not more often as a reminder of what is important, particularly at each stage as my girls grow.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must for all Dads, new or seasoned
customer_reviews.text: This book helped solidify and put scientific research behind some of the tough aspects of parenting that tend to fall out of vogue. This book brought me to tears many times while reading it because it provided support to what is truly important to know and do as a Dad, even if my wife and people around disagree. The prospect of winning the love and respect of my daughter, while keeping her safe and experientially guided where she lacks clear sight, in the long term is far more important to me than being a cool dad when she is young and needs leadership the most. Thank you for this very impactful work.
customer_reviews.author: Kmehta

customer_reviews.title: Why fathers should always stay around
customer_reviews.text: Making your daughter part of your life even in the little shores while paying attention to her helps her immensely. And above all, it is with your presence, example and communication that she will be a strong woman able to fight the current world while defending herself properly. Dr. Meeker, explains delightfully in her book with examples, statistics, researches and experience how to develop or fix a relationship between father and daughter properly.
customer_reviews.author: Annabelle H.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding for the papa
customer_reviews.text: I buy books for my husband from time to time and ask him to read them. He doesn’t. I bought this for him for Father’s Day. He reads a chapter every other night or so, on lunch breaks at his computer, then discusses it at bedtime. He is implementing the little things from the book and while he is a great dad, he didn’t have a great dad and his sister struggled. His relationship with our 8yr old has improved and he makes more time for her.
customer_reviews.author: MamaB12

customer_reviews.title: Have you ever found yourself wordless facing a situation with your daughter?
customer_reviews.text: This book was recommended by my sister. She is a pediatrician and she loves kids. She told me "you're going to love it!" and she was right! I learned a lot, more importantly, I found a practical way to be the best father in a practical way. Being a parent of princesses it's not an easy thing, and many times we can miss the opportunity to be there for them because something is not as important for us. Have you ever found yourself wordless facing a situation with your daughter? That's ok! It's normal, she doesn't need the perfect words from you, but she needs you to be there, being you, for her, that's all. Amazing. Loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: A MUST read for Dads.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! A great eye opener and reminder. I keep slapping my forehead like the people in those V8 commercials. I will be re-reading this one about once a year for many years. Excellent content and very easy reading. Filled with great stories and examples that bring the lessons home. I love my daughter and wish I would have read this sooner. But it's not to late to adjust the heading on my boat and do a little course correction in both our lives.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: More religiously tilted complaints about the modern era than parenting advice
customer_reviews.text: Chapters near the beginning of this book are loaded with complaints about sex education, television and US culture along with thinly veiled criticism of LGBTQ groups. I would be surprised if it did not continue in this fashion through most of the book, but I could not stomach it after the first few chapters.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre D. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful Information for both Fathers and Mothers.
customer_reviews.text: I just finished reading the book and I'm pretty impressed. Dr. Meeker writes it in a down to earth, and folksy way that is easily understood. I think that bother mothers and fathers could benefit from reading her advice. At times, the book does scare fathers about the realities young girls face in today's society. I think that's a good thing. I plan on keeping this book as a reference for many years to come. Great read and very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Metro Dude

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great book for fathers who need encouragement to be the dad we know our kids need. Honestly exposes society's norms and pop culture's attack on our children from a scientific and data based point of view. Easy read for a slow reader like myself. Full of anecdotes to exemplify the points given and full of scientific research to show how and why children need involved parents.
customer_reviews.author: M. Santos

customer_reviews.title: A “Must-Read” for Dads of Daughters
customer_reviews.text: Dr. Meeker does an outstanding job of backing up the moral and spiritual truths we know, with science that helps explain it. Sometimes we know something is true with every fabric of our being, but it takes someone else gifted to explain in a way that resonates with us. Additionally, in this book Dads (and parents in general) will gain insight and knowledge into what our daughters are struggling with, and what dangers they face if we don’t do our job. All Dads must read this book; whether Christian or not, no matter how old your daughter is now, this book will benefit you! One of the best parenting books I’ve ever read.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have daughters? A must read!
customer_reviews.text: For any dad that has a daughter, this is a must read. Does not matter your age or their age; does not matter where you are in life (single, married, divorced, etc.); does not matter your relationship with your daughter as whatever it is,(good or bad) pertinent information/advice is given on how to move forward. Dr. Meg Meeker (author) gives very real and practical information and advice. Have bought several copies to share with friends and family!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rose

customer_reviews.title: Without regarding the age of your daughter you have to read this book!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't matter if your daughter is only a few months old or if she is 40 years old, you have to read this book and apply the God-given principles to raise, and nurture a healthy, mature, smart, and happy woman. As her father, you are her first love, her superhero, her guide. She needs your strength and moral compass, your wisdom and your love.
customer_reviews.author: OCTAVIO FRANCISCO MEJIA

customer_reviews.title: One of the best, and most imortant, books I've ever read
customer_reviews.text: This book struck a chord in my heart that honestly changed my life. Being the dad to a daughter is the greatest thing I've ever been blessed with and this book showed the tremendous responsibility we as fathers have to our daughters. It's well-written, eye-opening, and has a tone of encouragement and cautious optimism that will help every dad who just wants to be a little better for their daughters to ge there.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Zook

customer_reviews.title: Fathers have a powerful impact on their daughters but few ...
customer_reviews.text: Fathers have a powerful impact on their daughters but few men understand this complex creature. Men, read this book and apply it's insight. You will reap a harvest of a cherished relationship and provide a platform for success for your daughter. Wives, buy this book for your man and hold him at gunpoint if necessary until he reads it. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: RTDT

customer_reviews.title: Well written, thought provoking insights from author with good daddy-relationship - rare to read about in today's world
customer_reviews.text: Really well written, thought provoking book. I bought this for my husband (we have a two year old daughter). He is really taking the messages to heart and appreciates the fact that this is written from the perspective of a woman who had/has a good relationship with her dad. Very good read for new fathers, but mothers can also gain insight from this read.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Chen

customer_reviews.title: Fathers are important in the lives of their daughters
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to read. This book shows the importance of fathers in the lives of their daughters but I would say it also encourages fathers to feel connected to their daughters and realize the power they possess to change their lives. Many men feel their influence in the lives of their kids is insignificant and this book shows how their involvement or lack of could make a world of difference.
customer_reviews.author: Redstone

customer_reviews.title: I send this book to every friend that has a new daughter
customer_reviews.text: With two daughters of my own, both very strong and excelling in life, I loved it and affirmed a lot of what once were common sense requirements to be a good father to daughters. This is a great book, whenever a friend or family member has a daughter I send it to them. There are some free range parents now that wont like it but its excellent advice for how to raise strong young women in a society that desperately needs them.
customer_reviews.author: MTNMAN

customer_reviews.title: Took this book to heart
customer_reviews.text: I have had this book for a while and found it most helpful. As a father with two girls I appreciated the view points of the author. I have loaned it out to my son and a few friends who have girls. What she says will make you a better father and give you a guide in helping your daughter to grow up to be a strong woman. Much of what she says I believe will hold true for sons as well.
customer_reviews.author: Thunderbolt02

customer_reviews.title: Truly a MUST read for Dad's with daughters!
customer_reviews.text: Dads... have any daughters? Please get this MUST read, and I bought several for some other dad friends of mine to give away. Don't capitulate you duty as a father, whether your divorced or married, and surender them to a world that wants to gobble up our daughters like a blender. You must be lovingly, strong and courageous or your daughters will go down paths of unbelievable sorrow. And it's never too late to start being a strong father. "I've never seen a girl in my court who's father loved her." - District Judge quoted (says it all) - Enjoy the book, God bless!
customer_reviews.author: P E R

customer_reviews.title: Well structured, with very good tips and examples
customer_reviews.text: I have readen other book from this author and this one, like the others, is really good. It reinforces the importance of a father in a girl/ women’s life. You can find good explanations about how the girl brain works, what to do and really nice examples about each chapter’s subject. I am still trying to convince my husband to read it, but at least I could talk with him about some of the subjects ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank You
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I raised 3 boys. Now in our 50's we find ourselves in the not so unique position of adopting and raising our infant granddaughter. As the culture, and specifically millennials, get further and further away from God and continue to buy into the secular humanist lies, anchors like this brilliantly written book are very much needed
customer_reviews.author: Gytaryst

customer_reviews.title: this book was a fantastic read reinforcing all the quality love and support a ...
customer_reviews.text: As the father of a 17 year old daughter, this book was a fantastic read reinforcing all the quality love and support a dad provides his daughter. A well written book that's a must read for any dad who loves and cherishes his relationship with his daughter!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Retz

customer_reviews.title: This book changed my understanding of my daughter. I loved it.
customer_reviews.text: I am a father and very much enjoyed reading this. It has changed my understanding of my daughter and my interaction with her. It helped me to better understand how she thinks and how important it is to what I say or do in her presence. I only wish I had read this earlier in her life. However never to late to have better relationship and a more positive influence.
customer_reviews.author: Don L

customer_reviews.title: Informative
customer_reviews.text: I really like this book. It was informative and thought provoking. I plan on using a lot of what I learned. Only issue is that it can come off as very preachy at times. Gave a feel of an agenda at times. Overall though I loved the book
customer_reviews.author: Jason J. Simmers

customer_reviews.title: Easy read. Great info.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my brother who has a duaghter. Then I snagged it from to read myself. The book was really easy to read and at times i couldn't put it down. Nice flow of information. Great advice. Somethings to really consider and think about when raising a daughter. I highly recommend this for any father that has a daughter.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Well worth reading
customer_reviews.text: This is a good read, albeit likely to cause anxiety to fathers as we learn more about the threats facing our daughters. The writing is intentionally provocative. While unsettlingly informative, I did feel it lacked much in the way of good advice as to how we as fathers can counter the negative pressures and influences our daughters are facing. The overall message of making sure to spend lots of time with our daughters, protect them and talk to them was good, but felt a bit lacklustre.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Advice and Encouragement Every Dad Needs
customer_reviews.text: I loved that Meg wrote from the facts she's researched and the cases she's encountered as pediatrician. The parenting advice for dads of daughters is practical, spelled out clearly, and backed up with evidence. I always hoped I’d have some sort of small chance at raising my daughters to know they are loved and valued, but this book has given me real tools (dads love tools) to build them up, strong and sharp, ready for the world - to face it and change it for the better.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H

customer_reviews.title: Field Guide for Fatherhood
customer_reviews.text: Thanks Meg Meeker for this exceptional and invaluable book on being a dad in this dangerous culture we face. I appreciate your personal insights as a daughter, the rich detailed case studies and the constant and confident delivery of ready to use practical advice. I have been corrected, challenged and empowered in my journey towards being a great father to three special girls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great quality, much needed resource
customer_reviews.text: Awesome audio quality, with on-time shipping. This audiobook really brings out alot of things that men, as fathers of girls, dont commonly think about... But need to, to be the best we can be for our girls. Very eye-opening.
customer_reviews.author: VicSpeed106

customer_reviews.title: Best $10 I Ever Spent.
customer_reviews.text: This book is powerful. It has changed the way I Parent my daughter and it has had immediate profound effect. Thank you Meg. I disagree with other readers that she get s righteous and too religious. Nothing but positives to take away from this. I listen to it in my truck all,the time.
customer_reviews.author: Norm Peters

customer_reviews.title: Strong faith, Strong Daughters
customer_reviews.text: I suspect there will be many that criticise this work of Dr Meeker's because she unashamedly takes what some might refer to as a conservative approach. But even more than that she brings faith into the equation and despite the facts she sights it will nevertheless offend some people. Therefore I highly commend her for stand and putting it down for all to read knowing it will be attacked and misunderstood. The book is filled with frightening facts and stories which should kick start father's into action. If anything the stories she quotes did feel a bit long winded at times. Overall a great easy read and definitely on the recommend list.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Prepare for the daunting task of being the father to a little girl
customer_reviews.text: Being a father is the most important job you'll ever have as a man. Be prepared. This book will challenge you to a task important and fulfilling enough to be worth devoting your life to.
customer_reviews.author: VirtualAlaskan

customer_reviews.title: As a dad and obviously male, the female mind ...
customer_reviews.text: As a dad and obviously male, the female mind is a mystery. I think the book gives everyone several things to think about, and we guide our children through life. I was surprised by the impact the author believes that dads have on their daughters, especially during the teenage years. I asked my wife to read the book to let me know her thoughts, especially since her father has had a very positive influence on her life. Regardless, the book pushed me to start reflecting more to ensure that I am guiding my daughter to be a strong and independent woman.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Answered a lot of other questions
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my husband because I want him to be the father to our daughter that I never had. When he started reading this, he had to stop and asked if I had read it. I told him no. He told me I really needed. Let’s just say this book answered a lot of questions about myself and explained a lot of my personal issues.
customer_reviews.author: RedGingerRoot

customer_reviews.title: saw changes in just 10 days!
customer_reviews.text: By chapter 5, and applying what was written, I was amazed that in 10 days how my two daughters (12 & 14) were relating to me. They just keep sitting there talking with me. Thank you for this book!
customer_reviews.author: C. Cole

customer_reviews.title: You can probably skip this one.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this book would be more spiritual/Biblical but it wasn’t. Then I thought the book would be more scientific/clinics but it wasn’t. So in the end, I think it’s just anecdotal opinions which may or my not hold true in mass. I decided to put the book down and move on. I’m sure it’s helfpul on some level but I felt most of the content was sweeping generalizations.
customer_reviews.author: The Swindles

customer_reviews.title: Good reminder for all dads
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this book and Strong Mothers, Strong Sons because I read in another book that helicopter parents tend to be moms when dads are absent from a child's life. One aspect I like about both companion books is Dr. Meeker's comment that many problems amongst children and teens exist because parents aren't strong enough in a positive way. Even better, I have noticed such in my children's lives. They are better, stronger and wiser when their parents are more involved.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Q.

customer_reviews.title: A "Must-Read" for every parent of girl(s)
customer_reviews.text: This book is a serious eye-opener and excellent tool to deal with fatherhood and daughters. And it should not be read by dads only, but mothers also need to know how much a daughter needs her father and how his influence (besides her own) is truly irreplaceable. Written by a female pediatrician with 20+ years of experience handling adolescents and knowledgeable of clinical and statistical facts regarding adolescent realities, I highly recommend it. A+++
customer_reviews.author: Abnel Rodriguez-C.

customer_reviews.title: I was nervous but decided that this book would be a nice start. It is the beginning and end for ...
customer_reviews.text: This book really put raising a daughter into perspective for me. Allow me to clarify, I am her stepdad and I had no clue how to raise a daughter until her mother came into my life. I was nervous but decided that this book would be a nice start. It is the beginning and end for me. I have used the knowledge gained from reading this book in many situations regarding my daughter and have had nothing but positive results. It can be preachy on a spiritual level but that should not stop you from buying this book.
customer_reviews.author: Nick L.

customer_reviews.title: A must have for parents of daughters
customer_reviews.text: I've read parts of this book, curious. I encourage all Dads and single moms to read this if you have daughters. I missed out on having a dad to look up too, I may have found my self much easier and earlier - not always having to learn the hard way . As a mom I talk to my daughter about issues with life, relationships but for her to watch her dad being involved in good ones is really important, and for her to feel accepted as she is for her own self. Great book.
customer_reviews.author: victoria

customer_reviews.title: I buy it for every father I know
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent and hard to find book that provides a very balanced view of how men should be a father to their daughters in a world where everything around young women seems to be pushing them to their own demise. My daughter will only be 2 in a few months. But I learned things I can apply in my relationship with her now until she's into her 20s. Meeker emphasizes behaviours that I have believed were true for a while, but she provides the stories and clinical experience to back up the ideas. Any father of a daughter whether newborn or 21 should read this book.
customer_reviews.author: Buehlerish

customer_reviews.title: Scary but necessary. . .
customer_reviews.text: Scary but necessary read for fathers of daughters. During reading and since, I constantly evaluate my interactions with my two and try to heed Dr Meekers advice. The book is a little religious for me. But even as an atheist, I still found it to be a worthwhile read because of the quality of advice and the depth of information provided.
customer_reviews.author: brendan dugan

customer_reviews.title: AMUST FOR NEW FATHERS WITH DAUGHTERS
customer_reviews.text: I have read this book twice i left a review on the deviotional. a must book for new fathers. i bought this book for a gift to my brothers they both have girls. Read the book take what you want form the book. The author is a Dr. That deals with troubled girls. DO whats best for your girls.
customer_reviews.author: kevin peters

customer_reviews.title: Want to raise a strong woman?
customer_reviews.text: Meeker takes her professional life and shows us the real world problem our girls face when father ingnore their Godly roles as father. Must read for all dads with little girls.
customer_reviews.author: Carah W. Muetterties

customer_reviews.title: It's all up to you!
customer_reviews.text: Every father should read this book when he has a daughter and he should read it every couple of years to keep it in his mind. I cannot tell you men enough times that you hold your daughter's future in your hands. You are her first love, her hero, her everything. All her life she will try to please you. When she looks for a husband she will be looking for you in that man. Make sure it's the right man she should be looking for. It's all up to you!
customer_reviews.author: Janet S.

customer_reviews.title: A must read for any parent, especially of girls
customer_reviews.text: A must read to understand a bit better the psychology of girls and the challenges they face. It provides a different perspective on the role of a father and how to care for them with a long term perspective
customer_reviews.author: Customer A

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - Highly Recommended!!!
customer_reviews.text: This book is excellent. Highly recommended for every father of a daughter. Is filled with not only information but also wisdom based on both personal and professional experience (author is an M.D.). Please read this book and pass it along to other dads. It could make such a difference in your daughter's life and future happiness.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: One of the absolute best books ...
customer_reviews.text: I first read this book 5 years ago when I didn't even have children ... My brother had recommended it, so I read it. Since then, I've read it at-least once every single year and I'm now the happy Dad to 2 little girls! This book is a MUST read for any Dad who cares about being a Father & Daddy ... We have a huge responsibility and this book reiterates that message. Very insightful and I recommend it to everyone I know who talks about being GREAT at being a Dad. I'm very impressed with the content and what it discusses -- Just a phenomenal message that all Father's should read!
customer_reviews.author: AF Guy

customer_reviews.title: Tells you the what, not the how
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this book, brought some great statistics and perspectives on sensitive subjects but doesn’t go into how to do the things she is saying. For example: Teach her humility and here is every reason why that’s good. But doesn’t say how and the best ways to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great book for any dad attempting to be a great ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book for any dad attempting to be a great father figure in this crazy world we live in today. Was recommended to me by a strong father and role model, have referred back to this book and others have picked it up as well.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great book! Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Not done with this book yet but my goodness its a great read in the morning! Learning so much and refreshing in many ways! Must have for super involved dads looking to elevate their parenting skills and knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler J M

customer_reviews.title: Helpful Guidance for Dad's with Daughters
customer_reviews.text: This book is extremely helpful in guiding dad's in their relationships with their daughters. It covers every aspect of building a great relationship, provides example cases, adds evidence from the medical field to backup statements and encourages dad's to stay on track and not give up, no matter what.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Read
customer_reviews.text: As a divorced father, this book truly blessed me. I have one daughter who has remained very close with me and one who is estranged. This book provided very helpful insights for both situations. I could not agree with the author more. Excellent job!
customer_reviews.author: Marc A. Medley

customer_reviews.title: Great resource for dads that want the best for their little girls
customer_reviews.text: If you have a daughter ... buy this book! Your daughter needs you to be strong, protect her from the world, and set her expectations for what to look for in a man ... a man who could one day be a good father to her own daughters.
customer_reviews.author: JRW

customer_reviews.title: Daughters still need GOOD fathers
customer_reviews.text: Very good book for dads of all ages. It gives good insight into the importance of good fathers despite what pop media dismisses as unnecessary and disposable in a modern family. The only critical thing I have to say is it has a definite Judeo-Christian centric chapter that you may or may not agree with depending on your beliefs. I agreed with the author's main point, but I wish the author had been a little more inclusive since fathers of all beliefs could benefit from the information in this book.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Show changer
customer_reviews.text: This book literally changed my life. That's it, it is that simple. Thank you Meg for showing us Fathers the way. If we know with our hearts that we must protect our daughters, we can also understand with our mind the consequences of so doing or not. If our head and our heart then work together we can be finally good fathers. And that is all that matters. My daughter is 6.
customer_reviews.author: miguelfeitosa

customer_reviews.title: All mothers and fathers need to read!
customer_reviews.text: This book focuses on the relationship between fathers and daughters, but mothers will learn just as much from this book. (Especially single moms.) Meeker's research supports a father's gut instinct to protect his daughter from others and from herself. Even when a daughter pretends her dad is out of touch, still really needs him, his support, and his boundaries. We also recommend Meeker's "Boys Should be Boys".
customer_reviews.author: J. Carnley

customer_reviews.title: For my husband, won't put it down
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the hubby as a gift. He's been reading it every night and has commented that he's found it insightful and a very good way to learn things about the female childs need for a father and everything that his new role as a dad entails as the man in his daughters life. Being a guy, some things about how a girl thinks and feels, has alluded him in life, this book helps shed some light in that arena and I appreacitae that it has given the husband some very specific examples of what being a strong father looks like.
customer_reviews.author: Lauryn J Harker

customer_reviews.title: A lot to swallow
customer_reviews.text: I have only skimmed through it because it was a gift for my daughter's father. It is fairly complicated and gets very graphic regarding sexual issues in chapter one. Too much for her dad- no chance that he will read it. Not a quick list of 10 things to know.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Mo

customer_reviews.title: Best gift to give an expecting dad
customer_reviews.text: Best book to give an expecting dad who’s going to have a daughter. I now buy multiples to give as gifts for the expecting dad. I love this book, so much valuable information in it.
customer_reviews.author: L Sims

customer_reviews.title: Great Fathers Day Gift
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this book. He reads one chapter a night to help let it sink in. He mentioned there is some stuff that's common sense in the book, but overall it's eye opening! I've noticed him saying encouraging and loving things to our 2 daughters more often since receiving the book and he even talks about the issues I dealt with growing up in a divorced family. I'm so so glad I bought this for him. I look forward to reading it myself. He said he will definitely be making it something he re-reads every year!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Inspire best books I have read in a long time! It really nailed home the importance of my role as a father of 2 little girls. It was one of those books where I highlighted something on almost every page because it was content rich. I would recommend for anyational and applicable
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best books I have read in a long time! It really nailed home the importance of my role as a father of 2 little girls. It was one of those books where I highlighted something on almost every page because it was content rich. I would recommend any father who wants to either better understand his impact on his daughters, or be a better father to read this book A great read that I will undoubtedly read again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must read for fathers, and also very helpful for mothers
customer_reviews.text: Dr. Meeker provides a compelling argument for the importance of fathers in the lives of their daughters. She also provides excellent guidance for fathers, as well as motivation for being the best we can possibly be. To be a parent requires selfless love, and that's probably the main reason so many people seek to avoid parenthood. This book is an important part of what fathers need to fulfil our critically important vocation. It encourages us to grow in our character, so that we can love our daughters more selflessly and more wisely. The result is exactly what the title of the book says.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Father's Day Gift!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this book for my husband for Father's Day, and he enjoyed the practical suggestions and eye-opening statistics that show the incredible impact that fathers have on their daughters. I highly recommend for every dad and couple to read while raising the next generation of strong godly women.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: Simply written, easy to read, and something every father should have in his library. Raising a daughter in today's world is fraught with decisions about social media, how much oversight daughter's need, etc. FATHERS NEED TO READ THIS BOOK. You have no idea how influential you are on your daughter. She may be an infant when you buy this book, but that's the time to read this. A father is every bit as important as a mother in their daughter's development.
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: best father/daughter book I've read so far
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great read. While a great book for us dads, I share a lot of material with my wife for discussion. Dr. Meeker does a great job of presenting statistics and facts while presenting anecdotes from her years of practice. She never relies on platitudes to get her point across which tends to plague a lot of father/daughter parenting books. I think this is a book both fathers and mothers should be reading. This is my first exposure to Dr Meekers works, I will start looking for more of her books.
customer_reviews.author: Mongo

customer_reviews.title: a blessing and very challenging
customer_reviews.text: Must read book for all fathers raising daughters. I truly found this book to be both a blessing and very challenging. You are forced to read about and consider things that as a father sometimes you don't want to think about when raising girls. Mrs. Meeker finds a way of challenging you and lifting you up to be the man and father our daughters deserve. Fantastic book.
customer_reviews.author: Efrain Ramos Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Audio Book - Learned a few things
customer_reviews.text: This book in some ways bashes single Fathers. Talks a lot about STI's/STD's. I am very familiar with this topic because I am in the Health profession. With all that being said I think its a good book to read and have available for your Fatherhood tool belt.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Meg does an excellent job explaining the importance of fathers
customer_reviews.text: Meg does an excellent job explaining the importance of fathers, as compared to mothers, in the lives of young women and how the relationship between a father and a daughter will so heavily influence the daughter's future choices in lifestyle, men and life. Must Read for new fathers
customer_reviews.author: Nelson J. Laplante

customer_reviews.title: A little heavy on the scare tactics
customer_reviews.text: Although the author offers valuable insights as a longtime doctor, she dwells on the negative aspects of raising a daughter without offering enough positives. The intent is there, but the scare tactics do not balance out with the rest of the content.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT READ!!!
customer_reviews.text: This book really opened my eyes. I thought I understood how important a father is to a young girl but i had absolutely NO idea until I read this. The true stories that Meg Meeker provide really help understand the female point of view. There were times I had to put the book down and hug my daughters(5yrs and 2yrs) because this book taught me that having their father in their lives is VITAL! You know those books that you read a dozen times and every time it gets better? This is one of those books. And it's very informative for all ages. Whether your princess is 2 or 18. Any father with daughters should pick this up. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: tony_martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: This book was very practical! I loved the wisdom and advice followed with real life analogy! I recommend this book for all fathers.
customer_reviews.author: xfracturex

customer_reviews.title: Surprizing Good Book
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good read. I am reading it based on a friend's recommendation. I thought a bit too moralistic in the first chapter or so, but the observations are astute and seem to be panning out for my 7-year old...
customer_reviews.author: John Sikking

customer_reviews.title: Changed my Husband
customer_reviews.text: This book is amazing. My husband is a great father, but after reading this book...he is more intentional about spending time with our daughter. He is building such a strong bond with her, and he will often bring this book up...talk about interesting things he has learned. He is excited to build a close relationship with our daughter and this book does a great job of providing him with the confidence he needs to do so.
customer_reviews.author: miss_tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Father's must read this!
customer_reviews.text: This book is a must read for every father! I love my daughter so much and i cannot fathom giving her any bit less than everything ive got! She deserves it! Fathers read this and learn how to relate to your daughter and be her best protector and to raise her in God's ways!
customer_reviews.author: Reuben Bjorkman

customer_reviews.title: Invaluable truth for a father to his daughters
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully written to fathers about imparting unconditional love and value to your daughters!
customer_reviews.author: Suellen Carson

customer_reviews.title: Easy read,  extraordinary value
customer_reviews.text: Great book all fathers should read. Very uplifting and motivating. 4 stars only because done of the story tenses and pronouns the me off a time or two. Definitely with the read.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Essential for Fathers (and Husbands) alike
customer_reviews.text: This book explains our current challenges in raising a daughter in our modern world. These principles also explain some of the challenges our wives have faced growing up, and how we can help understand what they desire and long for in life. Worth the time! Great real-life examples, encouragement, and stories!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: a must read
customer_reviews.text: This is a book both patents should read, in order to develop a game plan and be on the same page as we attempt to raise a bundle of hormones! Book gives perfect insight by leveraging the authors wealth of professional/personal background. She's heavy on the common sense, which in this day and age... is uncommon. If we all read this, it should keep our daughters off the pole.... which is every dad's goal. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Oprtnst

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Only 70 something pages into it and it seems like a very powerful message. I have two boys but this was my first daughter and it does a great job showing the differences and what a daughter needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book for a father to be a hero to their daughter
customer_reviews.text: This book is an easy read, but very heartfelt. When I read the book, I was only to go through a few pages at a time. A must for any father be an awesome dad. Teaches you how to raise a strong daughter who is able to measure and increase her self-esteem through what really matters, her inner-self, moral values and principles, through the relationships that truly matter in her life, and especially her relationship with her dad.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: This book helped me realize how important fathers are to their daughters. I'll admit that at times I was upset at the author for essentially telling us to be perfect. I later appreciated her advice as I now know that being the best father we can be to our daughters will only help to make us better as men.
customer_reviews.author: MIGUEL I. MURGUIA

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift Item
customer_reviews.text: This was a great gift for a new father. He appreciated it.
customer_reviews.author: Nona

customer_reviews.title: An amazing book I will most likely turn back to again and again
customer_reviews.text: I chose this book by sheer chance and have already purchased more copies for family members and Friends we have daughters. I'm going away at how insightful and accurate this book was from start to finish
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Must Read for All Fathers With Daughters!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent book! It’s written very straightforward and is loaded with page after page of helpful information. It’s helped me understand the three daughters so much better and has helped me take my relationship with them from good to great! I think this is a MUST read for all Fathers with daughters.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: Father's day gift! My husband loved!
customer_reviews.text: Very beneficial book for fathers! My husband enjoyed reading it!
customer_reviews.author: danielle

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Not enough practical info. More of an emotional story time type book. Perhaps could of had more bullet point lists
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bob Bobbington

customer_reviews.title: Maybe alot of this should be common sense, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe alot of this should be common sense, but for me it was still very helpful and helped me think more clearly about what it means to be a Dad to a little girl. When it says just giving your daughter the gift of your time, and being there really helped and encouraged me. I don't have to be Mr. sensitive and talkative all the time, I just need to be there for her.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Though provoking and relevant for all Dad’s.
customer_reviews.text: Very relevant and at times very scary analysis of young girls and what I need to do as a Dad to guide her through her life. Gives context to what she is going through and what i need to do to have an impact on her whilst building a strong bond.
customer_reviews.author: Adam jones

product_meta.title: Strong Fathers, Strong Daughters: 10 Secrets Every Father Should Know

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
